PolicyPage.Title: Purchase Requisitions & Purchase Orders
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Policy

All purchases of goods or services over $1,000 must be processed through the Purchasing Department. If the buying department wishes to use the Purchasing Department for items under $1,000, the same procedures apply.

Procedures

  1. Purchase Requisitions can be completed on the automated requisitioning system by accessing the following website location: http://web.byui.edu/Purchasing/Autopr/MAIN.ASP.
  2. Purchase Requisitions are completed by the requesting department/division with the information required including budget steward authorization, account code information, item description, requested delivery dates, etc.
  3. Purchase of Capital Equipment (Category Code 8400) must be approved by the Budget Officer for appropriated areas or the Director of Auxiliary Services for non-appropriated areas. After approval, requisitions will be forwarded to the Purchasing Department. Computer equipment purchases should be coordinated with your department/division Computer Service Representative (CSR).
  4. The Purchasing Department will process the requisition as follows for non-contracted items:
    • For purchases up to $1,000, selection can be made by purchaser/requestor determining the best value to the University with no quotations required.
    • Purchases greater than $1,000 but less than $5,000 require a purchase requisition processed with two verbal quotations required.
    • Purchases greater than $5,000 require a purchase requisition, purchase orders and two or more written quotations. When competing quotations are not available, documentation must include an explanation.
  5. Purchases made in the following categories do not require Purchasing Department involvement:
    -All purchases under $1,000 -Petty cash purchases -Real estate
    -Taxes -Postage -Payroll
    -Conference & Seminar fees -Insurance -Dues & Membership fees
    -Selected outside professional services (architects, engineers, doctors, creative writers, lawyers, etc.) -Magazines, advertising or newspaper subscriptions -Purchasing Card use
    -Utilities that are not related to a negotiated contract -Construction work awarded by Physical Facilities Department (not including owner-furnished items) -Contracted purchases described in paragraph 7 below
  6. When purchases are made under a contract, the contract number should be referenced as documentation for these transactions. Purchasing Department personnel can make these purchases according to the levels described in the Church Purchasing Domestic Handbook. However, any purchases over $100,000 must receive approval through the BYU-Idaho and CES approval and appropriation process.
  7. Contracted purchases can be made without the involvement of the Purchasing Department if the guidelines listed below are followed:
    • Approval has been given by the Supervisor of the budget steward and the Director of the Purchasing Department within an identified dollar amount.
    • Purchases are made according to the contract terms and conditions.
    • The contract number is referenced on the invoice.
  8. Emergency purchases can be made by contacting a Purchasing Department representative and obtaining authorization. Emergency purchases are classified as situations where life or safety is at risk and where immediate purchases must be made to eliminate or reduce this risk.
  9. When the Purchasing Department has placed the order with a vendor, a copy of the Purchase Order (PO) will be sent to the requesting department. The department should place the PO in an Open File for reference when the items are received and when the charge appears on the accounting reports.
  10. When using the University Purchasing Card, policies governing these purchases must be followed (see Purchasing Card Policy).
